biography.bio: Edwige Feuillère was born on October 29, 1907 in Vesoul, Haute-Saône, Franche-Comté, France as Edwige Louise Caroline Cunati. She was an actress and writer, known for L'aigle à deux têtes (1948), Love Is My Profession (1958) and The Pit of Loneliness (1951). She was married to Pierre Feuillère. She died on November 13, 1998 in Boulogne-Billancourt, Hauts-de-Seine, Île-de-France, France.
biography.name: Edwige Feuillère

biography.bio: The son of Italian theatre critic Antonio Cervi, Gino Cervi was one of the most famous Italian actors, first on stage, then on screen and finally on television. He appeared in his first play in 1924, a year after his father's death. He won world fame with three movies directed by Alessandro Blasetti: Aldebaran (1936), Ettore Fieramosca (1938), and An Adventure of Salvator Rosa (1939). After the WWII, his film career flourished, and then on television, he found new fame as Inspector Jules Maigret in a series of TV Movies based on the novels of Georges Simenon.
biography.name: Gino Cervi

biography.bio: Gianfranco Giachetti was born on September 27, 1888 in Florence, Tuscany, Italy. He was an actor, known for Old Guard (1934), Acqua cheta (1933) and La cantante dell'opera (1932). He died on November 29, 1936 in Rome, Lazio, Italy.
biography.name: Gianfranco Giachetti

biography.bio: Dina Perbellini was born on January 14, 1901 in Vicenza, Veneto, Italy. She is known for her work on Seconda B (1934), Les enfants nous regardent (1944) and The Overcoat (1952). She died on April 2, 1984 in Rome, Lazio, Italy.
biography.name: Dina Perbellini

biography.bio: Nora Hamilton is an actress, known for Amore (1936) and Twenty Dollars a Week (1935).
biography.name: Nora Hamilton

biography.bio: Guido Celano was born on April 19, 1905 in Francavilla al Mare, Abruzzo, Italy. He was an actor and director, known for L'immortelle (1963), Barabbas (1961) and La grande guerre (1959). He was married to Tina Xeo. He died on March 7, 1988 in Rome, Lazio, Italy.
biography.name: Guido Celano

biography.bio: Anna Maria Dossena was born on February 17, 1912 in Massa Carrara, Tuscany, Italy. She was an actress, known for Salò, or the 120 Days of Sodom (1975), Televisione (1931) and Film d'amour et d'anarchie (1973). She died on June 18, 1990 in Rome, Lazio, Italy.
biography.name: Anna Maria Dossena

biography.bio: Born in Florence, Checchi appeared in over 150 films in his lengthy career, which spanned from 1934 to his death in 1974. The son of a painter, he studied painting at the Accademia di Belle Arti di Firenze. Moved to Rome, he attended the acting course held by Alessandro Blasetti who gave him a small role in "1860". After graduating at the Centro Sperimentale di Cinematografia, he had his first role of weight in the 1940 historical drama film "L'assedio di Alcazar" by Augusto Genina. He later appeared in Mario Camerini's "Due lettere anonime" (for which he received a Silver Ribbon as best actor), Giuseppe de Santis's "Tragic Hunt" (1947), Michelangelo Antonioni's "La signora senza camelie" (1953), Vittorio De Sica's "Two Women" (1960), and Mario Bava's Black Sunday (1960), among many other films. In 1958, he won the Italian National Syndicate of Film Journalists Award for best supporting actor for his performance in the film "Parola di ladro" (1957). In 1971, he starred with Giancarlo Giannini in "E le stelle stanno a guardare", an adaptation of A. J. Cronin's novel, "The Stars Look Down".
biography.name: Andrea Checchi

biography.bio: Derna Bellavia is an actress, known for Amore (1936).
biography.name: Derna Bellavia

biography.bio: Elio Sannangelo was born on May 4, 1926. He is an actor, known for Piccolo alpino (1940), Amore (1936) and La route heureuse (1936).
biography.name: Elio Sannangelo

biography.bio: Elena Baracco is an actress, known for Amore (1936).
biography.name: Elena Baracco

biography.bio: Lina Tartara Minora was born on July 7, 1892 in Sale, Piedmont, Italy as Angelina Paola Tartara Conte. She was an actress, known for Lo vedi come sei... Lo vedi come sei? (1939), Amore (1936) and Lascia cantare il cuore (1943). She died on February 17, 1968 in Rome, Lazio, Italy.
biography.name: Lina Tartara Minora

biography.bio: Carlo Chertier is an actor, known for La banda dei rossi (1920), Amore (1936) and It Always Ends That Way (1939).
biography.name: Carlo Chertier

biography.bio: Giovanna Scotto was born on August 26, 1895 in Turin, Piedmont, Italy as Giovanna Piana Canova. She is known for her work on Aurora sul mare (1934), Deux lettres anonymes (1945) and The Singing Princess (1949). She died on December 23, 1985 in Grottaferrata, Lazio, Italy.
biography.name: Giovanna Scotto

biography.bio: Benito Monastero is an actor, known for Amore (1936).
biography.name: Benito Monastero
